subject: Kaup24.ee vastus taotlusele
bodyHtml:
Lp Gregor Eesmaa

Lisatud failina saadab Dlb Trading OÜ (kaup24.ee) vastuse Teie 31.05.2025 taotlusele.

Kuna Teie taotlus oli koostatud nii eesti kui ka inglise keeles, otsustasime Teile vastata ka mõlemas keeles. Tõlke lahknevuste korral palun lähtuda eestikeelsest vastusest

Lugupidamisega
Anna Aida
Jurist | Lawyer
 
+372 55530479
anna.aida@kaup24.ee
Peterburi tee 2f, 11415 Tallinn, Estonia
 
PHH Group
phhgroup.eu | pigu.lt | 220.lv | kaup24.ee | hobbyhall.fi
 
Pange tähele, et käesolev e-kiri võib sisaldada konfidentsiaalset teavet. Juhul, kui olete saanud käesoleva teate ekslikult, siis palume teil sellest koheselt teavitada sõnumi saatjat e-kirja teel, seejärel kustutage sõnum oma süsteemist, ilma et teeksite, levitaksite või säilitaksite sellest koopiaid.
 
Please note that information in this message and its any attachments is confidential. If you have received this message by mistake, please inform the sender of the mistake and immediately delete the message from your system without making, distributing or retaining any copies of it.

quotes: We have read with great interest the research report "Account Enumeration Vulnerability: kaup24.ee"
Regarding issue A, we have considered your finding and can indeed assure you that anti-bot measures were implemented
Regarding issue B, we do not acknowledge the enumeration, however the possibility is limited to targeted (spear) enumeration
Regarding issue C, I would like to point out that stated enumeration possibility is limited to targeted (spear) enumeration
we have implemented additional security mechanisms on registration and email exchange forms, including rate limiting
we are improving the responses and error messages of related systems to prevent the disclosure of user data to prevent unauthorized users from being granted access
we are developing a more comprehensive permanent solution, which is planned to be implemented in the near future.
We are aware of the security vulnerability and are taking measures to resolve it.
Regarding issue B, we do not acknowledge the enumeration, however the possibility is limited to targeted (spear) enumeration due to previously mentioned rate limiting.
Regarding issue C, I would like to point out that stated enumeration possibility is limited to targeted (spear) enumeration due to previously mentioned rate limiting.

Considering the Company’s legitimate interest in ensuring the security of the service and preventing fraud, we are obliged to implement the necessary technical and organizational measures to minimize the impact of such security risks.
We are aware of the security vulnerability and are taking measures to resolve it.
"performance of the contract (management of the user account and provision of the service)"
"legitimate interest (ensuring the usability of the service and prevention of fraud)"

"mentioned design is observed among all the biggest market participants and service providers in these specific forms (account registration from and email change of already registered account) and is a widely known as unsolvable issue with these specific forms in the cybersecurity world."
"Company´s legitimate interest in ensuring the security of the service and preventing fraud"
we have implemented additional security mechanisms on registration and email exchange forms, including rate limiting
we are developing a more comprehensive permanent solution, which is planned to be implemented in the near future
